Inferring trajectories with Slingshot

Source: R/ti_slingshot.R, R/ti_container.R
ti_slingshot.Rd

Inferring trajectories with Slingshot

Will generate a trajectory using Slingshot. This method was wrapped inside a container.

ti_slingshot(docker = dynwrap::test_docker_installation(), ndim = 3,
  nclus = 5, dimred = "pca", shrink = 1, reweight = TRUE, thresh = -3,
  maxit = 10, stretch = 2, smoother = "smooth.spline",
  shrink.method = "cosine")

ti_slingshot(docker = dynwrap::test_docker_installation(), ndim = 3,
  nclus = 5, dimred = "pca", shrink = 1, reweight = TRUE, thresh = -3,
  maxit = 10, stretch = 2, smoother = "smooth.spline",
  shrink.method = "cosine")

Arguments

docker

Whether to use the docker container or the R wrapper
ndim

The number of dimensions
nclus

Number of clusters
dimred

A character vector specifying which dimensionality reduction method to use. See dyndimred::dimred for the list of available dimensionality reduction methods.
shrink

logical or numeric between 0 and 1, determines whether and how much to shrink branching lineages toward their average prior to the split.
reweight

logical, whether to allow cells shared between lineages to be reweighted during curve-fitting. If TRUE, cells shared between lineages will be iteratively reweighted based on the quantiles of their projection distances to each curve. See 'Details' for more.
thresh

numeric, determines the convergence criterion. Percent change in the total distance from cells to their projections along curves must be less than thresh. Default is 0.001, similar to principal.curve.
maxit

numeric, maximum number of iterations, see principal.curve.
stretch

numeric factor by which curves can be extrapolated beyond endpoints. Default is 2, see principal.curve.
smoother

choice of scatter plot smoother. Same as principal.curve, but "lowess" option is replaced with "loess" for additional flexibility.
shrink.method

character denoting how to determine the appropriate amount of shrinkage for a branching lineage. Accepted values are the same as for kernel in density (default is "cosine"), as well as "tricube" and "density". See 'Details' for more.

Value

The trajectory model

Details

This methods was first wrapped inside R, see ti_slingshot

The original code of this method is available here.

The method is described in: Street, K., Risso, D., Fletcher, R.B., Das, D., Ngai, J., Yosef, N., Purdom, E., Dudoit, S., 2017. Slingshot: Cell lineage and pseudotime inference for single-cell transcriptomics.

See also

slingshot::slingshot()
